und.value:
Menlo Park , Calif. – At noon today, USGS scientists will provide a brief statement regarding the M8.8 Chilean earthquake and tsunami that it generated.  USGS staff will be available to answer questions. 

  • Archive of tweets from this press conference (Feb 27, 2010)

 

Who:

Walter Mooney, USGS Research Geophysicist

Ross Stein, USGS Research Geophysicist

Mike Blanpied, USGS Associate Earthquake Hazards Program Coordinator

Brian Atwater, USGS Geologist

What:

Geological perspective of the M8.8 Chilean earthquake and tsunami

When:

Saturday, February 27th, 2010

12:00 noon PST

Media availability for questions and interviews

Where:

Building 3, Visitor’s Center

U.S. Geological Survey

345 Middlefield Road

Menlo Park, California

 

Map and Directions:

http://online.wr.usgs.gov/kiosk/mparea3.html

Call in option:

877-953-4172  Participant Code 8654249

50 phone lines available, first come first serve.
